channel.title: 317 server sided emotion handling
channel.description:
Hello im building a 317 and now i need to add in my new emotions for the game. I thought it was easy but for some reason I don't get why the emotion you add in isn't the number of the real emotion. Heres what I mean.
On my server this is the case that controls the yes emotion [code]case 75001: // yes emote c.setAnimation(0x357); break;[/code]
But the yes emotion is really under emotion 855. I don't really get how this is supost to be added in if you have to kinda guess all of the emotion numbers. I though you would just add it in like c.setAnimation(0xID); for the emotion. Can anyone help me out here?

item.title: 317 server sided emotion handling
item.dc:creator: @runemaker runemaker
item.description:
@runemaker wrote:

ok thank you very much :D, i would rep if i could

Read full topic

item.title: 317 server sided emotion handling
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“runemaker, post:3, topic:340510”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=436879.msg3210088#msg3210088 date=1274153586]
If an Integer begins with ‘0x’ that means it’s in hexadecimal format and 357 in hexadecimal equals 855.
[/quote]

Do you think you could tell me how I would turn my emotion ids into hexadecimal numbers so I can add in all of my emotes to my new client please :D[/quote]You could do the math or use an online hexadecimal converter or just use a PrintStream in Java and print the Integer that is in hexadecimal format and it will automatically show the regular decimal value instead.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 server sided emotion handling
item.dc:creator: @runemaker runemaker
item.description:
@runemaker wrote:

Hello im building a 317 and now i need to add in my new emotions for the game. I thought it was easy but for some reason I don’t get why the emotion you add in isn’t the number of the real emotion. Heres what I mean.

On my server this is the case that controls the yes emotion

case 75001: // yes emote c.setAnimation(0x357); break;

But the yes emotion is really under emotion 855. I don’t really get how this is supost to be added in if you have to kinda guess all of the emotion numbers. I though you would just add it in like c.setAnimation(0xID); for the emotion. Can anyone help me out here?

Read full topic
